text:
A lovely crisp and happy pale ale. Sampled on draught at Ye Olde Fighting Cocks, St Albans having finished a sunny walk around the glorious Verulamium Park.

A fine ale, I think of Scottish origin. I will certainly sample this ale again when I see it!
Limoen en gras als aroma, waarbij een zoete weeïge limoen doorkomt in de smaak, samen met licht zuurtje. Ansich pilsig, maar wat matter. Niet een opvaller.

On cask in Edinburgh. Nice traditional bitter with some light breadiness that goes well with the fruity yeast esters. The "citrus" notes from the hops were pretty restrained and subtle, but they still worked nicely. Just a good pint of pale bitter.

500ml bottle. Pours slightly hazy light amber with a small white head. Lovely citrus,floral,honey and grainy bread notes on the nose. Goes down smooth and a rush of carbonation pushes around some pretty vibrant flavours for a light ale ! Lemon up front mellowing into a nice malty, floral honey and finishing with some bitter hops and grapefruit peel. Unbelievably refreshing and tasty. Surprised me this one as I dont really get on with beers under 4% haha ;-D
Yellow, mostly clear, with big white foam. Smells grassy and kinda sour. Taste is pretty sour, as well. Is this intentional? I get bready, grassy notes too, but seems a bit off.

From cask at the 26th East Anglian Beer & Cider festival, Bury St Edmunds. Pours light gold with a small white head. Aroma of grapefruit, lime, grass and straw. Medium sweetness, and medium citrus bitterness. Light body, watery texture, soft carbonation. Finish is dry and citrus fruit.
Cask. Pours a bright gold colour with a fluffy white head, aroma is all citrus fruit, the taste is medium bitterness with a dry bitter finish.
Cask. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Light malty and moderate hoppy aroma. Light bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. Elegant and nice.

Bottle from Morrisons. Pours clear copper gold with a white frothy head. Aromas are gentle with orangeade, light lemony hops and melted butter. Flavours as nose with a gentle syrupy malt finishing with a nudge of bitter grapefruit. The moderate carbonation produces an incredibly refreshing light session ale.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Chyba najlepsze klasyczne golden ale jakie piłem.

Cask Pint at The Grape & Grain, Crystal Palace, London in Mar 2011 - Very Pale Yellowy Gold in colour. Very Fruity; mega-citrus grapefruit and lemon; tangy, zesty. Very Hoppy; grassy hops. Malty backbone. Very full flavoured for low ABV. Quite bitter citrus fruity hoppy and fairly dry throughout. Liked this a lot. Lovely Beer! 
(2011-03-04)
Keg from Loch Fyne hotel in Inveraray, Scotland. Citrus on the nose, like a lager in appearance. Tastes very light and refreshing and you go get the citrus. So easy to drink. Perfect for a session.
@cask. Muy buena blond, con aroma ligeramente cítrico y floral. Poco cuerpo pero con mucho sabor. Final seco y ligeramente amargo.
Una Golden di alto livello, soprattutto al palato per la grande bevibilita. Amarognola con un grado basso e quindi molto facile da bere.
Nice bouquet on the nose a lovely golden colour nice very sweet buttery aftertaste on the palate

Interesting one. First taste is bland. But from then it develops into a really nice and complex maltiness with lovely hop flavouring. Really came into its own over time 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

13/20 Refreshing citrus lager. Only 3.4% and pretty pale but loads of flavour considering the low percentage

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pint in Oban after the Staffa tour. Pale copper gold, ample white head and lacing. Lightly toasted malt, a little Belgian yeast and some tangy lemon zest... Light and refreshing...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cask at GBBF 2016. Clear golden. Bready malt aroma, slightly fruity, floral hops. Medium bodied, low to medium carbonation. Dry, medium bitterness.
Draft Brewdog Roppongi. A nice citrusy golden ale, not infensely hoppy but clean and tasty. A very solid beer.

Bottle from Morrisons, Fort William 160624. 
Clear golden amber with creamy white head. Fruity hoppy nose with citrus and resins. Very nice palate with bread, malt, and very nice bitter resins and unusual citric fruitiness for an UK-beer. Especially re. it's low abv. Best beer this vacation 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tangy and zesty with a long grapefruit finish. On tap at the Tap East Stratford. Head disappeared very quickly

Backlog rating: Bottle purchased at Lochaline stores in April 2016. 

Pours clear light gold colour with bubbly white head. Citrussy aroma with some floral hops. Very refreshing and tasty.

Cervesa suau, amb aroma a cítrics, en boca segueix però també hi és marcada la galeta.
Cerveza suave, con aroma a cítricos, en boca sigue pero también está marcada la galleta.
Cant believe Ive not rated this before! 500ml bottle at home. Clear and golden, with a good white head. Citrus and biscuit aromas, flavour is grapefruit, orange with a dry finish
On cask at the Carters Tap. Pours clear golden, frothy white head. Nose of barnyard, hay, lime. Taste is dry, fruity and slightly sweet.

Cask at The Earl Grey Inn, Leek. A clear golden colour with a medium white head. Aroma of grapefruit, lemon, slight biscuity malts plus grassy, floral and herbal hops. Taste of grapefruit, lemon, some orange, slight biscuity malts plus grassy, floral and herbal hops. Light bodied and soft carbonation. A dry, slightly biscuity, floral hop bitterness in the finish. Started off with sweet citrus and malty flavours but then developed into a well rounded, well hopped bitter finish. Nice.

500ml bottle. Pours clear golden with a smooth small white head. Aroma is citrussy hops. Taste is also citrussy hops with that fruity hoppy bitterness at the end. Smooth dry finish, very nice and easily drinkable.

Big offwhite head. Clear yellow body. Fruity floral resiny aroma with elderflower notes. Dryish fruity resiny elderflower taste with spicy notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, soft, mealy mouthfeel. Dry resiny eucalyptus and citrus aftertaste with floral spicy notes. Lovely, fresh, drinkable. (0.5l bottle, from odd bins, Edinburgh.)

On tap at Euston Pub, London-- Pours a clear golden with thin and persistent white head. Nose is citrusy. Aromas are citrus, lychee and herbal hops. Average carbonation, medium body. Medium slightly bitter and fruity finish. Great session ale!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2016

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, wheat, fruit, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Hazy yellow/golden beer with a slight/medium white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, wheat and fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with hops and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. So much better than anything I can write down about it. Extremely drinkable and refreshing; amazingly quaffable. Such a strong flavour for its abv.

Bottle. After a pongy egg smell on opening, this turns out to be a great wee beer. Lots of depth for a 3.8%. Nice and dry at the finish. Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From XXXII. In Teku glass. After dinner. Very hoppy. citric. Watery buts its high bitterness hides it.
Cask. Golden yellow with white head. Hoppy aroma, sweet flavour with smooth bitterness, citrusy
pinecone and lemon aroma, pale gold with white lacing, no real flavour just a bitter floury texture.

Drunk many times but finally rated, Bottle @home tasting General Election 2015 (rating backlog) Pours gold, great lacing white head. Floral nose with grapefruit. Taste of peach nectar, orange and lemon with a slight spice after taste, good beer.
Pours light yellow with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt and grassy hops. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Body is too light, texture is thin, carbonation is medium.

Backlog rating. Cask at CBC Clapham, Craft 100, London. It pours a clean golden color with minimal white head. Aroma is floral, hoppy citric. Taste is crisp, grainy, grassy, lemony. Light bodied with soft carbonation. Overall, very nice pale ale

On Cask in the Raeburn beergarden Stockbridge. Pours a slight haze golden. Nice citrus hoppy grassy aroma. Lovely creamy mouth feel. Delicious hoppy flavours. Balanced. Good bitterness; quite pronounced. Always a saviour in pubs that otherwise only have generic brews on. Solid

Cask at Jack in the Box, Altrincham. Hazy light amber shade. White head. Notes conjuring up white fruits, underripe berries, straw, orange citrussy undercurrent. Quite dry at the finish. Solid body. Seems a well constructed pale ale with nice hop notes.

Bottle from Morrisons. Lovely looking beer, clean golden colour with a long lasting white head...nice lacework. Hops abound on the nose and palate, the 3.8 abv makes for a refreshing session brew that Id be more than happy to quaff a few of, lovely stuff!

Aromas of citrus and losts of them, Pours a nice golden colour with a light white head. Tastes of citrus burst out straight away, hoppy too. Light body with a think texture, lightly carbonated with a lingering bitter finish, A very drinkable session ale. Not much difference between this and Avalanche by Fyne Ales but I prefer Avalanche as its slightly smoother and a little more refreshing but all in all not a bad ale at all!
On tap at Churchkey. Nice golden body with medium head. Nose is citrus, oaky, hoppy. Taste is citrus, hops but also quite grainy and malty. Nice hoppy finish.

Owl Farm, Brooklyn tap: pours golden with a white head. Aroma is light citrus, sugar, it has a pretty powerful aroma for a blonde ale. Taste is nice and bitter. Body is light but not watery. Excellent.

Draught pint at the Free Trade Inn in Newcastle. This had flavour then some. I drank the lot and tapped the bottom to get the drops. They need to clean the toilets in that place, the line between authentic dive bar and very real health risk was probably crossed back in the 80s. Still would recommend the beer.
Golden with white head. Mango, papaya and guava. Sweet, juicy and hoppy finish. Overall: nice session cask ale.

[ Keg ][ 4oz ][ @Churchkey][ $3][ Snifter ][ 06.03.15 ]translucent gold, large bubbled white ring. Lightly buttery nose, light citrus and wood. Grainy bitterness up front, citrus and more grain mid very balanced, effervescence helping maintain session nature, more dryness trough doughy end, light but inoffensive butter through biting, sticky end, hops lingering long for contrasting and nuanced bitterness.
Cask at Siren, 10th July 15. Really nice session beer, light loads of hops, big flavour for the ABV, could drink a lot of this.
On Cask at Wellies Bar Ayr golden yellow frothy white head floral grassy aroma flavour is floral and citrus flavour lingering heavy bitterness on the finish

Blonde claire et limpide, très mousseuse, mousse laissant un dentelle en disparaissant très vite. Nez fruité de fraises, fruits rouges et citron. Bouche amère, corps aqueux, saveurs légères de fraises, framboises et citrons.

Golden color with a frothy white head with good lacing and lasting. Aroma has notes of camomile, floral hops, tea and slightly citrus. Flavor with a light bitterness with floral hints. Light bitterness in the final.

Cask, Moo Bar Carlisle. Grassy aroma, sweet malt is a little dominant surprisingly. Very easy drinking with a full fruity finish that rounds it off very nicely. Still think its a little too highly rated, but good nonetheless.
Some citrus with decent head. Pours golden with good head. Light crisp bitter finish. Great for style. Tap at Churchkey.
UPDATED: FEB 24, 2016 15 cl aus der Flasche. Festival der Bierkulturen 2015, Köln Ehrenfeld, #4. Helles, ganz leicht trübes Bier, weißer Schaum. Fruchtig, zitronig in Aroma und Geschmack.
Aroma of sweet mango. Pours golden with a thin head. Very smooth, fruity taste with a slight bitter finish.

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.
@ XXXII The Great Power of Beer & Wine.
A: Golden / Dorado.
T/S: Malt, caramel, sweet / Malta, caramelo, dulce.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden beer with a big, bright white head on top. Aroma is malty, some citrus and crisp. Flavor is quite bitter, citric and hoppy. Very refreshing bitterness going on, malty sweet aftertaste and very full bodied. Good carbonation going on, it all suits the beer well. Very decent stuff!
Had in tap at fynefest at fyne ales brewery nice refreshing beer for a hot summers day would drink again

Bardzo bardzo aromatyczne piwo. Zapach swierzo dojzalych pomaranczy, cytryn i innych cytrusow. Piana srednia ale trwala. Kolor jasny, zlocisty i klarowny. W smaku lekkie ale goryczkowe i cytrusowe. Doskonale wytrawne i cytrusowe. To dominujace wrazenia. Bardzo dobre szkockie Ale. Polecam

On tap @ La Capsule, Lille - FR. Color: clear pale blond beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: hoppy and grasy domination. Notes of litchi and peach. Pineapple finish. Taste: very fresh taste, grassy and pineapple. Small litchi finish. Hoppy, easy drinkable. Aftertaste: grassy and litchi with pineapple. I like the small ABV, 3.8 its perfect !

Very light straw colour. Nice head which paces throughout. Lively looker . Fizzy .very citrus. Refreshing light and fruity. Not disappointed by fyne yet again. Do agree slightly with comment below that too many golden ales are jumping on the citrus bandwagon .

Cerveza de color amarillo dorado con una pequeña cabeza blanca.
Aroma con fuertes notas de lúpulo y limones.
Sabor afrutado suave con un final seco y amargo, muy refrescante y excelente cerveza.

This beer was all over Edinburgh when we visited last year: but this review is from 2015. 2nd April, half-pint in The Fighting Cocks, Oakengates. Light golden body with a thin white head. Citrus hop aroma and taste. I have said enough times I am fed up with golden beers that are citrus flavoured and this is yet another of them that is flooding the UK market. This one however seemed better than most and I almost enjoyed it.
25.1.2015. Cask. Pours golden with white head. Citrus, light grapefruit. Taste continues. Slightly watery but works. Citrus, grapefruit bitter.

Cask at the Manor Arms, Broughton-in-Furness. Light yellow with a large white head. Grapefruit aroma, slight tropical fruit. A hint of soap. Taste is bitter but not intensely so. Long finish as a light citrus bitterness lies on the tongue. A tasty hoppy golden beer.

* Bottle. Pours cloudy blonde, with a white head. 
* Aroma is strong, citrus, grapefruit, orange, honey & faint grass. 
* Palate is medium bodied, low carbonation, very fine bubbles. 
* Taste is fresh, hoppy, grapefruit & lemon. 
* Finish is refreshing, slight vanilla. 
* Sweet, tangy, easy drinking.
Cask at Babbity Bowster, Glasgow. Pours yellow with white head. Fruity and hoppy aroma. Medium hoppy and fruity flavor. Bitterish finish. Light bodied. Very drinkable.

0,5 l bottle from Scotia Spirit, best before august 2015. Minimally hazy, pale golden yellow with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, white head. Nice, citrusy aroma of lemon zest and orange with hints of vanilla. Very refreshing, slightly bitter and citrusy taste of lemon zest, grapefruit and pineapple as well as cereals and vanilla. Good! Crisp, medium bitter finish. Thin body but not watery, spritzy mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very refreshing thirst quencher and easily drinkable. Very fruity, quite complex but not overcharged. No need for a radler anymore!

BOTTLE 33CL. Almost an alcohol free beer, being at 3,8% ABV and a few days from its BB date, the aroma is very intense and clean, with sweet fruit, light citrus, honey sweetness and some grassy notes. The flavour is not too bold, but not even close to being watery. It is dry, with just a hint of honey, lots of hops, no prickly CO2 or tannins. Theres a touch of aspirin-like harshness in the bitter finish. Very nice. [backlog 20150124]
UPDATED: MAR 29, 2015 enjoyed this, lovely white head, lively, crisp taste with a decent hit of citrus
500 ml bottle - pours golden with white head - low aroma but fruity/floral taste from hops. Moderate malty background - overall - not bad, light and refreshing.
500ml bottle from the brewery via eebria. Golden beer with a thick white head. Hops check, cirtus, check, nice and easy to drink.

Very hoppy with a strong fruity grapefruit type aroma. Very bitter with a strong aftertaste, but the taste doesn't live up to the aroma. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pint at the Bodega, Newcastle. Heard a lot about this before trying. Hazy gold with a white head. Citrus and privet aroma. Has that lovely trick that few blonds of this strength can pull off of full on citrus with a hint of creaminess, like a good quality orange cream chocolate. Nice astringency in the finish. Scored high on a wet Tuesday evening in Newcastle in November, probably 2 points better on a Sunny Sunday afternoon in August in a beer garden overlooking a river.
Cask in the George Hotel, Inveraray. Straw coloured with a frothy white head. Bitter with plenty of citrus. Light and refreshing. Very good for the ABV.

Pint at the Dalriada Edinburgh. Big citrusy hops in this one and great flavour. Not a 3-4 pint beer despite its lowish alcohol but the richness of the flavour makes it a great beer to taste and savour. Very thin looking though and looks a bit Ill actually. Good grassy flavour and tingle on the palate. Nice stuff.

[ Bottle ][ 3oz ][ The Festival LA ][ $3 ][ Taster ][ 11.8.14 ]
>> Low haze straw pour, weak foam. Nose is squashy, older dry hop, fresh fruit. Taste is clean, squashy yellow fruit, mildly soapy, grassy hop forward, dry. Easily drinkable, nice.
On tap at the black sheep in Dublin. Golden pale ale with almost no head. A little bit bitter at the end. Not too bad.

Bottle
Not much in Aroma but makes up for it with the hoppy flavours and the bittering finish which lingers, tropical fruits flavours - citrus and sweet malts coming through

Bottle in Scotland 23/10/14.
Had this several times before and its a top Golden beer. 
Clear Golden/amber with slight malt taste, excellent body and Citrus edge. Hoppy tastic.
Cask, various places. Pours golden, nose is citrus, lemon, taste is juicy fruit, refreshing.

Cask. A perfect example of how a seemingly light beer can be so full of flavour, depth and complexity. The structure between supple biscuit and light lingering pine resin is so firm and superbly balanced. Probbaly the best cask all rounder in Scotland today.
Bottle at home. Hazy yellow pour, thin white head. Aroma of fruity hops, slighty spicy, citrus and tangerine. Flavor is quite bitter, fruity and hoppy. Nice balance and a decent body for the low abv.
At 3.8%, this is a good session beer. Easy to drink. Balanced malt and hop flavour. Nice clean finish. Similar to Magus of Durham Brewery.

Spina @ Eurhop 2014.
Chiara schiuma bella.
Leggera citrica beverina, poco carbonata.

Bottled 500ml. -at China Buffet King Glasgow. Yellow coloured, small white head, mild citric nose. Light malty, citrusy and mild fruity with herbal hoppy notes in rather bitter finish. Distinct bitterness in the aftertaste. Really good brew for 3.8%.

Cask at Eurhop beer festival 2014. Light golden yellow, quite clear, with a small, bubbly and frothy off white head. Lovely citrusy and tropical hop notes, both fresh and pungent, perfectly clean. A hint of bready malts and lemon peel as well. Pretty big astringency upfront, relatively harsh feeling, feeling heavier than the actual ABV. Nice mild hoppy bitternessm just a hint of honey and pale malts in the aftertaste. Soft carbonation, medium body, creamy texture. Nice, but the mouthfeel turned me off a bit. Ok overall.

At Eurhop festival in Rome-Italy. Pours yellow, just a bit hazy with a tick and lasting white cap. Nose is mild hops, distinctive malty notes. Mouth is very drinkable: dry, floral, and slightly bitter palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with McTapps. Very fine one with a deep body even if the ABV is quite law. Citrus and hops in the dominance with some touches of grass and straw. A delicious light piwo with some special moments. Thumbs up !

Bottle from Scotia Spirit in Cologne. The beer pous out in a clear golden colour with airy low head and medium to thin body. Wonderful aroma of fresh hops, citrus and spruce. Taste of fresh hops, spruce, grapefruit, thyme, coriander, herbs, pink pepper, flowers and straw. Wonderful hoppy, yet mild finish. Enjoyed it.
Aroma is tropical fruit, hop resin and mild spices . The flavor is tropical fruit, light citrus/fruit, mild hop resin, malts, spices and a bitter/dryish finish.
Draught. Smooth and floral. Easy to drink but still deep. Hints of grain, nice floral aftertaste! Great stuff!!

Draft at Churchkey. Hazy to cloudy pale yellow color, massive thick white head with great retention and solid lacing. Aroma of white pepper, summer fruit, haystacks. Taste is freshly cut hay, black pepper. Very nice.
Cask on gravity at GBBF 12/8/14. Pours pale yellow with a white head. Aroma of grapefruit, very much grapefruit. Bitter sweet finish. Great stuff.
liked this beer quite a nice fruity taste going on a perfect beer for a hot summers day

Bottle
Aroma-fruits, citrus
Appearance-pale, clear, white foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, lightly sour, lightly bitter, 
Palate-light body, sticky, lively, astringent finish
Overall- very drinkable

Cask. Clear golden with a medium sized good lacing white head. Grass, soapy, dry flowers, white bread, light sulphor. Medium body, oily texture, light sweet and medium bitter. Long dry and light/medium bitter finish. No complaints.
Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours hazy gold with a near-white head. Aroma is sort of herb. Flavor is very citrus with herb. Finishes very citrusy bitter. Nice session ale.
Bottle from Star Grocery. Pours cloudy blonde with a modest off-white head and a salty citrus aroma. There is a very bitter pale malt and grapefruit flavor that is surprisingly hearty and refreshing.
Peach nose, Apricot, pineapple, plenty of fruity maltiness, hoppy dry finish. Nice tasty hoppy brew with such a friendly abv, a tad too bitter maybe.
On tap at the GJBF in Osaka 2014. A very clear light straw gold. A nice sweet caramel & hop aroma. Not complex but solid. Light bodied but silky smooth. Clear hoppy pine with light sweetness.
Bottle from Rehills Newcastle. Pours dark golden colour. Strong peachy, fruity aroma and flavour with strong hop ubdercurrent. Very nice.

@ Sergios / Louisville --- Slightly hazy pale gold color, good head cover, strips and strings of lace. Taste is wheaty malt that loses its place quickly as solid citrus hops enter and overstay their welcome. A lot of flavor for 3.8%, but most of it is hops. Quite drinkable, but it feels a lot like a one trick beer.
Pale golden yellow, white head. Aromas of citrus. Taste medium bitterness. Overall slightly tired.
Straw yellow with a disappointing head, it has a lovely citrus hop flavor. This beer would be awesome to drink on a sunny day.
Fra fad, Tørst, NYC. Strågul, hvidt skum. Frisk citrus-humlet næse. Strå. korn. En lille smule kiks. God balance. Frisk, stram, lidt simpel, relativ bitter

12 oz. bottle best before Feb 2015. It pours a pale yellow gold color with a small disappearing white head. The aroma is bready and lightly citrusy with some grapefruit and grass. The flavor is very citrusy with strong grapefruit, orange and some grassy, pithy bitterness in the finish. The body is thin, but refreshing and it get more citric acidity as it spreads across the palate. There is a some light hints of bread and even some spicy noble hops toward the finish. Really a pretty nice low gravity session ale.

Cask at the brewery. Straw coloured with a tight white head; crisp citrus aroma; some sweet grapefruit adds to the flavour; and then theres a clean finish. A really good light ale - apparently they are struggling to keep up with the demand.

Bottle. My favourite blond/golden ale.
Really sessionable but packed with lovely citrus hop flavour and aroma.
Highly recommended.

Bottle at home. Pours lightly hazy gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium-short retention with light lacing. Aroma is biscuit and honey malt with earthy, minty, and woody hops. Flavor is moderate hops and bitterness, light crisp malt and fruity esters with a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.
Cask at the Bow Bar. Pours pale golden yellow, tun white head, aromas of citrus and straw. Taste has good bitterness, nice light caramel malt backbone. Clean finish. Good.
Straw colour, aroma full of fruity, curranty. Snappy bitterness and deep fruity hops. Great stuff, massively refreshing.

on cask at the cask and barrel in edinburgh. very pale shade of golden with a minimal head; very fresh, citric aroma; crisp, light grapefruit, good hit of bitterness; pretty tasty for a low alcohol beeer

Thanks CGarvikUk! Still pretty damn fresh. We dont usually get fresh UK beers over here. Pours thin, as it should. Citrus and tropical on the nose. Goes down easy. Supremely crushable. Tight bitterness in the finish. Great beer, under 4%. Wish I could get this year-round.

Draft. Slightly hazy yellow pour, small fizzy head. Nose and flavor bring, unfortunately, a touch of age in the form of an undistinct caramel and biscuit note, along with just a drop of buttery diacetyl. Still, some nice orange peel and lemon hop character shines through. Crisp and clean. Would love to try at the source, but you can see what it was.

At 3.8% ABV, this could be the most accomplished hoppy session ale I have ever tasted. The citra hops have their characteristic early pop in the taste profile, but what is exceptional is how the taste sustains and creates residual bitterness through an extended period of time. This, along with several Brew Dog offerings, was the saving grace of a recent trip to Scotland. A special session ale that I would snap up if it were available in Canada.

From cask @ Borefts 2013. A cloudy golden yellow one with a small bubbly cask white head. Smells of nice citrus with lots of fresh summer flowers, some hay, grass and it just smells really fresh and nice. Summerly. It has a light prickling really soft carbonation level and a gliding soft oily mouthfeel. Really really balanced in the taste. Soft citrusy, mild and round. There is a little hint of pineapple and pine here. Super lightdrinkable and actually really good. Could easily drink this again. A sessionable and lightdrinkable golden! 28.09.2013
Golden in colour, small white head, citrus flavour and aroma, dry and very sessionable.
Poured light golden with a small white froth. Aroma of zesty citrus hops and soft malt. Light body, flavour is tart citrus, lemon, pine, underlying biscuity malt. Lingering refreshing bitterness.

Draft. Straw yellow, with a small off white head. Light grassy and citrus aroma. A session ale, with a thin-ish body to match. But a taste that delivered much more than the body and aroma promised: lemongrass, grapefruit, some gentle florals. Perfect for a long summer afternoon. (And it went down very well on a wet January evening, too!)

500ml bottle from Galvins, Bandon Rd. Pours a slightly hazy straw yellow/golden with a thin frothy white head. Aroma is quite lemony, quite grassy, with some very delicate floral notes also. A little sharp on the nose, somewhat lagery. The taste is better, with initial light malty sweetness which has a certain sugary character to it, medium citrus bitterness, with more pronounced floral notes and quite a clean bitter bite. Slightly dry finish with a lemony aftertaste and some grainy hints, with soft carbonation. Overall, it didnt give a great first impression and wasnt quite as good as I recalled from my first experience of it a few years back, but still a tasty brew, particularly for the ABV!

Bottle to plastic cup at Hop Revolution 2 Tokyo
Wheat, lemon, lots of citrus
Yellow bubbly white head
Lemon, wheat, some bitterness
Borefts Beer Festival 2013. Pale golden with a small white head. Malty aroma of biscuit with notes of citrus and peach and a hint of diacetyl. Dry and fruity flavour
Gedronken met benzai en dutchdrebus. Pilskleurig met een witte schuimkraag. Ruikt hoppig, fris en naar loempias. Smaakt hoppig, fris, citrus, "lemon grass". Voor dit alc. perc. best wel goed.

Bottle shared with Dutchdrebus and Ansjelaah @ weekly tasting. Clear yellow golden color, medium sized white head. Nice aroma of hops, lightly malts, lemongrass, very fresh. Taste lightly malts, lightly a touch of fruits, hops, nicely bitter, lemongrass. Medium body, average carbonation. Superb session ale.

Bottle @ benzai. Slightly hazy pale yellow colour with a small to medium sized white head. Smells malts, hops, grassy, slightly plastic. Tastes quite malty, cardboard, some hops, slightly grassy. Nice body considering the abv, aoft carbo.

14/12/2013 Ma che siete venuti a fà (handpump). Bevuta a Birre Sotto lAlbero. Dorata, paglierino, lievemente torbida, schiuma bianca molto abbondante e persistente. Al naso malto, biscotto, note fruttate, deciso agrumato, pungente. In bocca è luppolata decisa, leggero attacco di malto, quindi finale abbastanza persistente amaro, secco e pulito. Corpo leggero, carbonazione soft. Ha una buona personalità, non male.

Bottle from Asahiya. Big fruity hop nose -- Citra and buttered cornbread. Medium straw, very light haze, almost no head. Smooth initial, with some tropical fruit, and a bit of peppery weight in mid / final has a tobacco juice rough edge. Interesting.

Aroma: hops, citrus fruits. Appearance: hazy, light gold. Taste: medium sour, light bitter. Palate: malty, long and bitter. Overall: very pleasant Golden Ale, very drinkable. Bottle from Odd Bins Pimlico, London.

Pours cloudy lemony yellow. White wispy head. Blood Orange aroma. Sherbert flavouring with grapefruit bitterness. Nice balanced beer but lack of alcohol reduces body and it is a little watery in finish.

Draft @ Borefts. Aroma is floral hops and bisuict malt. 
Flavour is dry fruity hops, intense lingering bitterness. Nice.
Golden color with a creamy white head. Aroma is very hoppy with some citrus notes. Flavor is pretty much as the aroma, low carbonation and medium bodied with a long bitter mouthfeel. good one.

50cl bottle courtesy of and shared with JMGreenUK.
Thin creamy white head. Slightly hazy pale golden pour. Hoppy aroma. Nice hoppiness. Nice brew.
Pint in Milnes in Rose Street, Edinburgh. Quite pale. Tastes much better than it looks.

Cask at the Plockton Hotel , 19/10/13.
Clear pale golden/blond with a good sized white cap that retains well.
Nose is juicy hops, light tropical fruit sundae, mandarin, light pine - a great nose for a 3.8% cask ale!
Taste comprises grapefruit, light tropicals, toasted malts, light grass, fresh hops.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, crisp finale with light hop bitterness.
Top draw golden blond!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Cask /gravity at the Questors Grapevine beer festival, gold and almost headless, with a fresh citrus hoppy nose. Crisp and clean, with a good balance of sweet golden peachy malt and dry grapefruit hops, the grapefruit bitterness lingering in the mouth. Lovely.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 28.09.2013, cask @ Borefts:
Tiny bubbly head. Aroma is slightly fruity, light malts, dried fruits, canned fruit syrup, flowers, pineapple, hay, herbs. Taste is very mild and grassy, light malts, hops, hay, herbs, grass, hints of dried fruits. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly dry mouthfeel. Nice and easy drinking.
Cask. Golden coloured. Unclear. Dense beige head. ARoma. Flowers, herbs, sweeetness some caramel. Flavour. Flowers, sweetness, caramel, light citrus. Medium bodied. Ends herbal bitter.
Draft at BBF13Clear light golden. Small white head. Easy going, very drinkable. Mild bitterness.

Bottled, BB Feb 2015, large sample. Clear golden color, medium white head. Aroma is fruity, citrus, grassy, some grainy pilsener malt. Quite bready malty flavor together with some citrussy fruit. Although its not casked beer, it definitely has a UK feel to it. Pretty bitter, which lingers on in the finish.
Tap at Borefts. Clear golden colour with small white head. Fruity, citric and malty aroma, with some honey. Fruity hops and bitter taste. Light body.

@borefts 2013
bread, floral hops, citrus (citra perhaps?) nice bitterness, good body... great beer
Dry and mildly citrusy. Easily drinkable, light bodied and crisp. Tried at BBF, 2013.
Draught @ Borefts Beer Festival, 2013. Pours clear yellow with a small white head. Citrus and hay. Floral hoppy with a touch of crackers. Bitter finish.
Cask @ Borefts 2013. Pale blonde. Grapfruit, lemon and lychee aroma. Firmly hopped with grassy earthy hops. Lychee and citrus, Great light ale.
Zeer lichte heldere kleur. Fruitge hop, bloemen geur. Lichte smaak, bitter en prettig.
Cask at Borefts Bier Festival 2013. Cerealy and hoppy with a dry finish, not bad
Borefts 2013 - Clear blond. Hoppy aroma. Flavour has some grapefruit. Very smooth and creamy texture.

Pours a pale clear beer with a good white head.
Smells fruity, citrus.
tastes grapefruit and citrus with a good bitter finish.
Dry texture, average carbo and a thin body.
Draught at Borefts, 2013. Pale gold color, low head. Lemony, grass nose. Herbal hops, quite bitter, light, crisp flavor. Good low-alcohol beer.

@Borefts 2013
licht geel met witte kraag
aroma: erg hoppig, fris en fruitig, lekker
smaken: matig zoet, fris, lekker fruitig, hoppig bittertje, redelijk biertje.

On tap/cask at BBF 13. Clear golden colour, no head. Aroma of citrus, passionfruit, a little cloying and typical English nose. Flavour is something else, firm zesty hoppiness, citrus, passionfruit, light grapefruits, lime, bitter hoppy finish. Light-bodied, watery, but tasty.

Draft at Borefts 2013. Pours clear golden with a small, soapy white head. Aroma has grassy hops, bit floral, some citrus and malts. Taste has some malts, grassy hops, over medium bitter. Medium bodied.
Cask @ BBF 2013. Pours clear light golden with a tiny white head. Aroma is bready, nuts, toast and floral. Lovely! Taste is light bitter and light sweet. Light body and soft carbonation.

Sampled cask @ Borefts 2013. Clear white wine with no head. Nose is light apple, honey touch hop. Body is a bit watery, herbal, slightly mineral, some bitter hops & slight grapefruit hop in the back. Light & watery. Okay but not particularly exiting. The other Fyne stuff was way more exiting, bit confused here about the very high score.
Draft at BBF13. Pours clear golden with an off white head. Aroma of citrus, light grapefruit and malt. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Pale golden, bit foam, low carbonation. Very bitter and dry beer. Hoppy aftertaste. Good!

ivory white head disappears with some lacing. yellow colour. aroma of mango, hop, weed. taste of grains, fruity, mango with moderate bitter aftertaste. quite dry mouthfeel, medium body and carbonation. not bad for the low abv.  tap @ borefts 13
Tap at Borefts 2013. Poured a clear light amber with a thin white head. The aroma is big malt. The flavour is medium bitter with thin dry malt, liqourice bitter, slightly watery palate.

Cask @ Southampton Arms, London. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, grassy, citrus. Flavor is malt, grassy hops, citrus, light grapefruit. Medium body, soft carbonation, light bitter finish. 180913

Pours a hazy straw colour with right white head. Aroma is lemon, a hint of cat piss. Light body, slightly thin. Mostly citrus - lemon, grapefruit - coming through. It's got a nice bitter tang to finish. OK. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

August 28, 2013 - cask at The Pelt Trader. Clear light gold with a small creamy drool of white head. Light honey and heather grain aroma redolent with pungent grassy bitterness. Taste is more grassy, but reserved - very nice balance - quite light and immensely drinkable. Mild carb, medium grassy finish, just a hint of hay in the linger. Very nice stuff.
Chiara buona schiuma discreta persistenza citrica leggera nota fruttatata buona beva secca rinfrescante finale citrico

very pale golden color. Creamy white head. Very hoppy nose with lemon zest and cereal notes. Very hoppy sharp mouth. Hops definitely shine and for 3.6% this shows great character. This could even do well on west coast US. Fantastic

Bottle at Crate Brewery in Hackney, London on 13 July 2013.
Poured a very light golden with a faint haze and a thick white head. Fine and abundant carbonation. Floral hop aroma. Grassy bitterness with hints of grapefruit and other unripened fruit. Dry, slightly earthy palate.
golden colour with slack head poured correctly without sparkler as all real ales should be,nose grainy with citric notes,flavour full on fruity with bitter edge long lasting dryish finish
500ml Bottle (EBBC 2013, Edinburgh) - Golden in colour. Soapy hops with notes of lenon, tea and peach in the aroma. Hoppy and slightly soapy taste with grain, tea, lemon and passion fruit detected.
Cask at Markie Dans, Oban. Pours clear pale golden with a small white head. Aroma of citrussy hops. Taste is smooth, light bodied with plenty of lemon and light sweet malts to go with it. Nice beer.
Bottle from crate. Light yellow. Persistent white head. Weird hop veg aroma. Fine carbonation. Bitter.
A really nice golden beer. Passion nose (!) that is very flavoursome and very tasty. Perfect for all occassions.
Cask at Angleterre, Helsinki. Originally rated 09092012. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, grass and hops.
The head is ok, body light and cloudy. It smells bitter, hoppy, interesting. The taste is hoppy, thin, hoppy-bitter, bit flowery. 12/12/12/12/13/12
Lemon and a light malt in the aroma, an excellent light beer, tasty and pleasingly light.

Pale, slightly cloudy straw gold. White head which settles to a few spots quickly. Fresh straw, lemon, Kaffir lime in the aroma, flavour follows suit with a mix of sweet sherbet malt, citrus and a touch of grapefruit. As light bodied as it looks and quite soft carbonation. Finish is mellow and gently bittersweet. Low enough ABV makes this one an ideal sessioner, very good.

Cask, pours a cloudy head then clears up to a clearish amber. Subtle but hoppy aroma. Slightly bitter finish, hoppy taste. Really smooth and nice

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(cask) pours a clear golden-yellow colour with a frothy white head. aroma of bread dough and citrus fruit, slightly sweaty, with a hint of herbal hops, straw and light pepper. flavour is mostly barnyard and herbal hops, with the slightest hint of butter, straw and yeast. light to medium-bodied with soft carbonation.
Cloudy golden pour, frothy white head.  Lemon, lime, pine, grass.  Zesty and refreshing.  Hoppy with lots of citrus.  Bitter, sweet with a hoppy finish.
fantastic. complex, light, a little yeasty but not too much. a really gorgeous drink, especially for a summers day but in general anyday. love it.

Half pint at Sheffield Tap.  Gold with creamy head.  Light citrus aroma.  Nicely hopped, not overdone, citrus zest and a hint of grapefruit.  Pleasant and perfectly chugable, with a bitter aftertaste.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2013 From a  cask. Babbity Bowsters, Glasgow. Lovely ale, very refreshing,  flavoursome and well balanced ale. Very hoppy with citrus notes. At 3.8% a great session ale.

Drank this from a bottle now also and it reminded me how good this is. Biscuity with aromatic hops of grapefruit and floral character. Excellent.

Pours cloudy light orange, sediment present. Fruity, floral and dried leaves aroma. Get a fruity and grapefruit taste. I quite enjoyed this. On a hot summers day it would be really good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPad

Cold bottle.  Very pale yellow peachy colour like apple juice.  Funnily enough it smells of apples and peaches too.  Fair bit of flavour for a low ABV beer, but its still quite watery.  The hop flavour is actually quite earthy in contrast to the fruity smell.  Toned down elderflower.  Sessionable, but Ive had better session beers.

Sampled at GBWF13
Golden with a bubbly head. 
Flowery aroma with elder. 
Smooth palate. 
Citric flavour with elderflowers. 
Light and fresh.

Sample at En Öl&Whiskymässa 2013. Clear pale golden beer with a decent white head. Hoppy citrus aroma, floral notes, grapefruit, hay notes, lime, some lemongrass. Hoppy citrus flavor, lemongrass, floral, orange peels, hay, some dandelions.
Golden colour, ever-so-slightly cloudy, with a one finger creamy white head. Aroma is hoppy and this is followed by a fantastic hoppy/floral sweet taste. Very drinkable.

500ml bottle from BeerRitz. Clear pale yellow-straw colour, foamy white head leaving some lacing and aroma is grapefruit citrus. Taste is caramel malt, tangy grapefruit and a slight biscuity note, with a very dry lingering bitterness. Light bodied, well carbonated, quite drinkable.

500ml bottle from The Real Ale Warehouse, drunk today. Light gold, clear. Pours thick, fluffy white head, which lasts very well. Good lacing. Mid-light carbonation. Aroma - Very fresh, very zesty grapefruit & a bit of sweeter citrus (tangerine). Lots of juicy, aromatic citrus rind oil. Very fresh, tangy & clean-smelling, and grassy. Also a touch of floral-ness & some lemon. Fresh hop oil - bit spicy. Behind that, a nice, crisp, cereal-ish, grainy, unobtrusive pale malt. Lovely, complex, but citrus-dominated aroma, that isnt OTT or perfumey; just appetising. Taste - Balanced & light, with lot of citrus. Very lightly sweet, cereally pale malt: Fairly standard pale malt body, for a blond ale; bit understated, malt is inoffensive & very much secondary to the aromatic, dry citrus flavours. Quite a lot of citrus flavours going on, but perhaps unsurprisingly, they dont quite live up to the intense aroma, though still good. Lemon, sweet grapefruit & grass. Lightly bitter hops. Bit of floral. Lightly dry, lightly bitter finish, with some dry citrus zest flavours left on the tongue, leaving you wanting more. Light body, with a bit of creaminess for mouthfeel. Very drinkable, with lovely citrus aromas & flavours, with a crisp & refreshing finish.
500ml bottle. Clear straw colour with a thin head. Plenty if grapefruit, a little grass, some honey and a long, very dry, bitter finish. An excellent session ale.
500ml bottle. A grapefruit-flavoured golden ale similar to many available in Britain at present. Its done quite well. Good flavour for low gravity.

Pour- light gold-yellow with 1.5 finger white head that persists. High carbonation. 
Aroma- kiwi-like citrus fruit and light hops
Starts sweet fruity quickly with on and off herb hops. Good balance between the two. Medium carbonation. Almost bitter finish that decreases in intensity with aftertaste. Very drinkable.

Cloudy, off yellow in colour. Small head, lots of lacing. Refreshing lemony, citrus aroma and taste. Bit floral as well, summery, little bit of herb. Slightly bitter/sweet, well balanced. Carbonation is perfect, leaving lacing all the way. Long, bitter finish. Overall, one that I thought would struggle to live up to the hype but worries were very much allayed. Roll on the summer.

Bottle, pale golden pour with small head, big citrus aroma, hints of lemon, a nice malt backbone and with a nice bitter finish. This is as good a session ale as I have had, lots of hops and flavour for the ABV

Real Ale tasted at Kittys 0.25L. Malty and hoppy and slightly peach nose. Pale head (4mm). Pale golden slightly hazy colour. Fresh malty fruity and hoppy taste. At the end hoppy bitterness. Some hints of lemon in the taste too.

Bottle, from Hippo Beers in Glasgow. Light, refreshing, gently hoppy - this really is an extremely drinkable session ale. Ill be stocking up on this for the summer - itd be perfect with a barbecue on a sunny day!
Craft Beer Co, Clerkenwell 1 Nov 12. Lys gylden. Nesten ikke skum. Grapefruktaroma & smak. Uforanderlig - men god.

Cask at the Euston Tap, London. Pours pale yellow with a fine, white cream head. Crisp pale malt nose, straw, dry lemon. Light sweet flavor with dry crackers, biscuits, mellow citrus. Light bodied with fine carbonation. Clean, dry finish, more pale malts, biscuits. Solid. Very mild grassy hops at the end. Super drinkable. One of the best widely available British golden ales.

500 ml bottle. C3R. BB Nov 2012. From the Fyne Ales Brewery in Cairndow, Scotland.
Cloudy pale yellow golden colour with small to average sized creamy and fluffy white head.
Very nice intensive citrusy, fruity and floral hoppy aroma with moderate bitterness. Flavour is floral hoppy with notes of resin, some mild sweetness and nice bitterness. Very tasty 3.8% brew. Excellent! More beers like this please.
UPDATED: APR 27, 2013 Very pale. Citrus notes in abundance. Crisp and refreshing. Head very creamy, left lacework all the way down glass. Excellent session beer.

UPDATED: JUL 1, 2013 (Bottled) Very pale golden ale with a thick, frothy head and a light, hoppy aroma with a citrus edge. A very bitter, hoppy flavour with a bitter, lemony backtaste. Enjoyable but I?m keen to try it on tap.

(Cask) Aroma is more distinctive in the cask version and I think the citrus flavour comes through more strongly as well. 

Rating is for the cask.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; pours straw yellow minimal head, feint hoppy aroma with a bit of lemon, quite thin in mouth feel, tastes superb citrus hop slight tobacco. Only 3.8% Fyne have done a great job with this.

Cask at the Euston Tap. Pale straw coloured yellow beer. Hoppy citrus aroma. Very well balanced beer, light and quaffable yet full flavoured, grapefruit citrus and long nagging bitter finish. Super session bitter.
Bottle. A really tasty golden ale. Lights citrus hops with a smooth malt backbone. I could drink absolute buttloads of this gear.

Cask at CB & K, Pimlico. Terrific one to session on a gorgeous sunny afternoon in estimable company. Faintly cloudy gold, with a modest scrim of bubbles. Soft fruity nose and a kiss of bitters for good measure. Smooth mouthfeel, lightly prickly palate. Flavors brim with brightness and citrus hops, backed up by a pine finish. So good.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Had been wanting to try this for the longest time. It certainly is a very solid Golden indeed. Good level of hops, some vegetation, a lightness from the abv. Orchardy. Super easy to scoff. Although I hate labelling things as sessionable, this typifies sessionability-ness.
On tap at the Grey Horse in Balerno. Tastes a bit like an IPA, a little citrussy and hoppy.  Nice.

Cask @ Black Door, Helsinki. Clear golden yellow with a thick white lacey head. Citric, hoppy aroma with some malt and grain, maybe a hint of soap. Hoppy flavour, mainly citrus and floral notes, but also some malt and grain. A citric, dry finish.

Cask @ Kittys, Helsinki

Pours light yellow with a small bubbly head. Aroma of fruity hops, some citrus and grassy notes. Taste is nicely hoppy and fruity with notes of citrus, grass, pine and exotic fruits. Finish is bitter and hoppy with mild fruity notes. Well balanced, excellent session beer.

(Cask at Kittys, 20120822) The beer poured pale golde and a little bit hazy. Its head was small, dense, long lasting and white. Aroma had citricness, resin and pine. Palate was quite light bodied with almost medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, citricness, pine, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was hoppy and bitter. A very tasty hoppy brew and still surprisingly balanced despite the quite thin body.

Bottle. Golden with fluffy white head that lasts a while. Biscuit, floral, grass, citrus in nose. Taste is oily hops with a strong floral component and lemon zest. The flavor profile is pretty remarkable for the low abv--much like a strong golden ale or belgian style ale.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2012 This for me is the ultimate session ale. its just beautiful! for such a low abv, this beer has everything you could wish for. its got a sweet citrus bite with the perfect amount of bitterness and carbonation. can be sipped all day without sending you completely doolally. a joy!

Amazingly strong aroma for the style, really strong citrus with grass and hops. Taste is a lovely dry bitterness with some citrus and good hop character. Full of character for the low ABV. Exceptionally good example of the golden ale style.
On my quest for golden ales this is another cracker. So much flavour for 3.8%. Want this on tap.

Cask ale, half at Bruadar. By the courtesy of JohnRMurdoch. Pale golden body, decent white head. Fresh floral-fruity nose. Taste of dry lemon and mid-sweet malts. Sharp hopped bitter ending. Nice (Glasgow, 12.04.2012).
Light refreshing beer. Great session ale with a grassy and citrus hop flavour over a light and refreshing malt. A super drinkable beer which is lovely for a lazy afternoon.
Cask. Pours light golden with a small head. Aroma citrus, grass, hops. A hot summer day drink.
Cask by air pressure at Bruadar, Glasgow (12 Apr 12) - strong dry lemon aroma, clear pale gold ale, creamy white head, well-hopped citrus flavour, bitter aftertaste

Bottle. Bright lemony yellow, slightly hazy, with a thick creamy head that laces thickly. Aroma is pungent green grassy hops with citrus undertones and an earthy edge. Flavour is very hoppy, grassy and green, with a light, lively mouthfeel and a crisp dry finish. 3.8%? Really? This beer is amazing.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
perfect drink for today.
lovely light carb that dances the flavours around your mouth. pleanty of citrus notes with a balanced maltiness. pine in the finish with a light bitterness
very good.

bottle. beerritz

Cask in Euston Tap. Very pale yellow/golden, thin white head. Nose is husky grain, lemon, gooseberry and citrous. Body is very light but theres lots of sunshine in this golden ale. Grain husk, citrous, caramel malt. Very nice.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is yellow. Aroma and taste are rich bitter hops, citrus, pine, malt and elderflower. Nice bitter finish.
Bottle. Pale golden with medium white head. Aroma is malt, hops, grass and a little citrus. Flavour is malt, hops, grass, earthy, citrus, little sweet and medium bitter.
Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - earthy and citrus. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 060312

50cl bottle. Pours a lovely hazy gold with bright white head. Big citrus notes in the aroma, bit of pine & slight peppery notes in there too: very fresh. Taste is full of citrus fruit, lychee, a little pine and a very smooth buttery sweet malt backbone. Satisfying bitter finish. A perfect session beer, a real summer afternoon drink.
Delightfully hoppy golden ale, goes down very well and has a slight aftertaste.
50 cl bottle, Sheffield, UK via Beer Ritz Leeds. Hazy pale yellow, lime and coriander aroma. Bright flavour, more citrus with a heavy lemon-pepper infusion. Finishes light with a pine resin ending.
500ml. Skunky, thin head. Light but cloudy. Quite tangy, slight pepper notes. Fruity.

(50 cl bottle) Light yellow color, slightly hazy, with a brightly shining creamy white head. Beautiful! Very fruity hoppy aroma of lychees, gooseberry, lemons and grapefruit, but no sweetness at all. Pale malt base well-hidden. Dry, bitter taste. Refreshingly thin texture and average carbonation. Long, dry finish. A lot of aroma for 3.8 % alcohol. An very, very good session beer - highly recommended!

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2015 Review is a combination of bottle, cask and keg. Clear golden body with a white fluffy head that slowly fades. Excellent lacing. Aroma of lemon, peach, lychee and a subtle hint of champagne. Flavour of grapefruit, pale malt, Rich Tea biscuit and orange sherbet. Thin body with an oily mouthfeel. Light fizz. Crisp, delicate and hoppy - the perfect summer drink. Perfect for any season, actually. Certainly one of Scotlands best beers.

Cask Laurieston Glasgow.poured crystal pale gold,thin lacing. Lemon,champagne and watermelon on the nose. Mango and grapefruit not overwhelming for citra, plenty carbonation. What a beer for 3.8%. Best ale in Scotland and possibly UK at this ABV. Stunning !

Described on the label as A hoppy blond session ale this light golden cloudy ale offers the curious distinction of a complexity of flavour yet done whilst retaining a lightness that makes it undemanding and with a moderate alcohol level of  3.8% one you can enjoy.

Bottle, bought @ Bierzwerg.de.
Pours clear, light pale yellow. Small, staying, frothy, white head. Aroma is lovely piney, grapefruit and good zesty lemons. Medium carbonation, nice dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has citric zest, pine, grapefruit, light resin. Super elegant citric bitterness. Light herbal in the finish. Truly impressive for the ABV.

Ive had this from both cask and bottle, its now dotted around various pubs in Glasgow and bottles can be found in Oddbins.  Named after  the vikings who pillaged much of Scotland, Jarl, from the excellent Loch Fyne Brewery, is an award winning (or so I was told by the barman in The Libertine) pale-ish, hints of floral ale, that goes down smoothly and leaves a satisfying taste.   A fyne addition to any beer cupboard!
very good nose. hint of lemon and light pine resin . a lovely light malt flavour with full hop profile .very fresh flavours .excellent blond finished beer with gentle haze. soft carbonation.
Cask at Teuchters. Amber/gold with diminishing white head. Hop derived citrus flavour. Dry finish. Very nicr.

from bottle, the american beer world could learn a lot from Jarl. There is no need for high ABVd beers when this much balanced flavour can be snuck into something so sessionable. Fresh grassy scents of summer. bitter hops and lemons leading to a damn fine lingering flavour. Sublime

500ml bottle pours a pale golden color with an abundant white head that settles to some fine lacing.  Aroma is pleasing mild citrusy hops.  Taste is a pleasing citrusy hop bitterness with a bit of malty sweetness.  Light to medium body and moderate carbonation.  This is a pleasingly light ale with an abundance of flavors, a winner all the way.

Pale yellow, hazy, small white head, fair lace. Sweetish, citrus, rather bitter, very hoppy. Grass hops clinging to your teeth, dry mouth feel. Well brewed, balanced, different.

Bottle courtesy of and shared with my dad at home, cheers dad consumed 08.12.11   Pours hazy pale yellow with a slim white head. Nice light carbonation. Initially there are some light soapy hops but these are not too overpowering, there is a dryness, touch of lagery flavour, citrus, and a minerally edge. Good beer.   A7 A4 A7 P4 Ov14  3.6

500ml bottle. A clear, bright golden coloured beer that poured with a large & rocky, slowly disappearing white head leaving a scattered soapy lace. Vibrant, zesty & juicy citrus hop aromas of lemon, orange peel, with grapefruit touches & a floral edge. Dryer flavour characteristics but still zesty. Pithy lemon peel, tangerine & a dab of resin finishes off each sip. Light to medium body, quite a bright & effervescent, firm & crisp mouthfeel. Dry & lingering hoppy bitter finish. Good hop & carb sting. A session golden that, even bottled, shines where others of the ilk fall down; crisp, full of flavour, refreshing & moreish. One to try on cask for certain.

Cask @ Bow Bar, Edinburgh.
Rated on 20110725.
Pours clear yellow colour with small head. Aroma of citrus, grass, fruits and light malts. Flavour of lemony fruits, malts and hay.
2314

Bottled 50cl. It pours a clear pale golden beer with a mountainous white head. Great hop profile. Sweat, grapefruit, quince and vanilla throughout. Light bodied. Good bitterness. Beautiful lacework. Biscuity pale malt back. Average carbonation. Remarkably dry finish which is reminiscent of grapefruit, whipped cream and vanilla. A masterpiece. Extremely delicious.

Cask @ Old Mill, Brodie
Very light straw colour, clear, frothy 2 finger white head, good lacing.
Aroma of citrus grapefruit and grassy hops. Much stronger aroma than usually expected at 3.8%
Taste - hoppy grapefruit and grass hops, bit of resin, excellent flavour for the abv
Palate - soft carb, thin watery body. Finish - lingering hoppy finish, rather bitter with grassy hops
Overall - technically brillant beer by Fyne Ales to get so much aroma, flavour and a good finish for such a low abv.

Cask Laurieston Glasgow. Pours clear pineappleade yellow. tight lacy head. Aroma all peaches, lemon amd grapefruit. Taste melon, grapefruit and space dust. Carbonation excellent. This is to die for at 3.8%

50 cl bottle, BBE 11/2012. Poured clear golden with a lacing white head. Aroma is very citrus, floral, hoppy, grapefruity even. Hint of metal in aroma. Flavor is bitter hops, citrus and  some leathery notes. Bitter, dry fruity finish. Thin, but very drinkable.

Bottled 500ml (BZ, BB 11/2012)
Pale golden color, decent white head and some lace. Strong fruity-hayish hoppy nose. Grapefruity hoppy flavor - lots of grapefruit actually, pale malty. Lots of flavors for 3.8 % beer. Of course a bit thinnish, but nice session ale.

Cask at the Grape and Grain Autumn beer festival 2011, Crystal Palace.  Light gold with a white head. Citrus and malt nose. Nice citrus zing in the flavour complemented by an underlying malt presence. Light bitter finish. Excellent session beer.
Huge grapefruit aroma, pale golden colour with fluffy white head, grapefruity taste but slightly lacking body and a touch over carbonated - that said, a great beer.

Bottle 500ml @ Papsoe
Pours clear very light yellow with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt and grassy hops. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

Bottle at Papsø.
Clear yellow coloured with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, grass and sulphur.
Fruity flavour of hops, grass and grape fruits.
Dry hoppy finish.

clear yellow, smooth white head.
yeast, malts, hops, mild but pretty dry. aroma
flavor is tasty flowery, bitter hoppy,

Bottle 50 cl. Courtesy of cgarvieuk. Pours a pale yellow with a slight haze and a white head leaving a discreet lacework. Fresh, citrusy hop aroma. Light body, a dry fruitiness with and almost astringent bitterness. Very refreshing and quaffable. 131011

Aroma:Very fruity-citrus aroma,floral...
Appearance:Clear gold,good head...
Flavor:Good fruity aroma,floral...

AROMA: citrus, grapefruit
APPEARANCE: clear, golden almost yellow, minimal head
TASTE: light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour
PALATE: medium body, creamy, lively, bitter finish
OVERALL: nice beer that is reminiscent of Belgian/Dutch Witbier. Nice balance of sweet/bitter/sour. The grapefruit is a bit on the strong side for me.

(bottle) Clear, pale golden colour with a blond medium-sized foamy head. Fruit-accented hoppy aroma with distinctive notes of grapefruit and a slightly zesty touch. Bitter flavour, light bodied with a crisp carbonation. Dry mildly malty taste with a good dash of citric hops, including a tinge of exotic fruits; dry and bitter hoppy finish with loads of fruity aroma hops. Very pleasant and moreish, not only on a hot summers evening. 03.IX.11

(Bottle at home)  Light hazy pale yellow ale with a small head.  Nice lacing.  Nose is all about fresh lemons and hops.  Mouth is just enough sweet, hoppy and fruity with flavors of green lemons.  Palate is on the medium side with the right amount of carbonation and a oily texture.  Bitter notes at the end of the road.  Really tasty.  First class afternoon beer.

Bottle: Clear, golden, stable white foam leaving rings on the glass, dominant grapefruity-citrussy nose; solid dry bitter flavour, light bodied and soft; lingering grapefruity-hoppy finish with a balancing amount of pale malt. Fyne........!!!!!!

Cask at the Craft Beer Co. It pours straw yellow, with a decent beige head. The nose is white bread, lemon, tangerine, grapefruit and pepper. The taste is initially melon, then: pine, resin, leaf and grapefruit, with a mouth-numbing, dry finish. Light body and soft carbonation. A refreshing session ale.

In short: A clean and crisp blonde ale with a fresh and grassy and citrusy hop character.  Very good thirst beer
How: From a bottle at Mondial de la Bière 2011
The look: Clear blonde body topped by a small white head
In long:  The moderately hoppy nose is grassy and citrusy.  Body is crisp pale malts, crisp half-dry hay sensation.  The hopping is a bit mostly dried yellowed grass and some citrus fruits.  Bitterness level is in the medium range and the finish has a nice dryness.  Pleasant clean and crisp mouthfeel.  Similar to Fynes own Avalanche and Hurricane Jack except that Jarl is more dry grass and more tasty than the other two.  Even if Jarl was the most intense of the three I still preferred the other two (especially Avalanche) because they felt even more refreshing and beers that I could drink 8 gallons of (instead of only 7 gallons of the Jarl).  Ive had only three beers from this brewery and they were all very good, I need to try more.  I need a quick answer from someone, what are the best Fyne Ales, where can I buy them and also what is the right religion?

Bouteille de 500ml. Bière blonde très très claire, la mousse est dune blancheur immaculée. Elle semble artificielle et elle est durable. Le nez est tout en houblon avec des notes dagrumes. La bouche est agréable, le houblon prend presque toute la place. Une vrai summer ale, un régal à boire à grande lampée. Jadore !! 8/10

On cask at Teuchters. Pours a pale straw colour with a decent white head. Lovely aroma of passion fruit, pineapple and light barley. Quite bitter with flavours of pine, pineapple, mango and light barley again. Nice dry linger. Lovely!
Cask at The Rake. Clear golden - white head. Nice hoppy. Fruity. Grape fruits. Light petroleum. Zesty. Ok bitterness. Citrus. Lemon. Light dusty. Nice freshness.

Cask at Kilmartin Hotel, Kilmartin.  Lightly hazy golden. Pleasant citrus aroma. Dry and light bodied, firm and vital with lots of tangerine and citrus. Really bitter finish. A pleasant light, yet hoppy golden ale.

Bottle from appellation wines. Pours very pale yellow with medium carbonation. Aroma is citrus, lemons with slight skunk. Very nice mouthfeel, refreshing. Inition flavour is citrus lemons followed by a bit of skunk. Good but not great
pours a very pale yellow with a decent white head, retention and lacing. fresh citrusy, some herbal coney notes, hint of sweetness. light body - lacking a little, average carboantion.

This might be the ultimate session ale! Incredible citrus aroma. Bery similar to the avalanche and hurricane jack, but its more pungent, and intense. Great big juicy notes of grapefruit, and a touch of skunk. Perfect body and carb, at 3.8% you could drink this forever.

Cask at GBBF 2010. A light golden beer with no head. The aroma has strong notes of hops and lemons. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt and lemons, as well as a lighter note of butter, leading to a dry and bitter finish.

5th July 2011Slightly hazy pale gold beer, small white head. Light and semi dry palate. A trace of sulphur here but nothing too distracting. Nice seltzerish grapefruit with a good bitter kick. Minerals. Could be mid 3s without the sulphur.
Cask at Craft Beer Co, London. A golden coloured pour with a small white fluffy head. Hoppy, citrus fruit aroma. Tastes hoppy, malty, citrus fruit. Really tasty for such a low strength ale.

Cask gravity, Derby Summer BF 2011. Tried on the (eavesdropped) recommendation of a CAMRA chap behind the bar. Third in the Great Hall watching some septuagenarian Dixieland jazz cats swing like muthafuckers. Pale yellow with a lacing, well-retained foam. Spliffy, mouldering satsuma aroma. Big waft of ganja at the front; well-wrung greenery, breakfast juice, just the right trace of Rich Tea to finish. Top stuff. A great rating experience.

Cask conditioned	air dispense	Euston Tap	London.  A golden coloured beer with a whitish head.  A good hoppy beer.  Quite piney in the nose but with good citrus flavours in the mouth.  Good oranges.  Sharp tasty and well brewed.  If anything more understated than predicted.

A blonde ale with a thick white head. In aroma, a surprising catnip hop, biscuitty malt, very nice. In mouth, a peppery hops concoction, biscuitty malt, catnip, a nice quaffer. Bottle at Mondial 2011, June 10, 2011.

Verre de dégustation, provenant dune bouteille de 500 ml, au Mondial de la Bière 2011 (Montréal, QC). Arôme: Odeur dhoublons avec une pointe de céréales. Apparence: La couleur est blonde pâle avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de céréales et dagrumes avec une pointe fruitée. Durée moyenne de larrière goût.  Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût sec. (Rating #3708)

UPDATED: APR 4, 2012 Hand-pull at SRAF 2011. Pale amber pour, some bubbly head. Light clean citrus/grass nose. Nice bitter front, hint of breadiness with a smooth but definitely hoppy linger. I don?t think it?s amazing, but it?s good. Re-rate, cask at Cloisters. Pale golden, thick creamy head. Amazingly juicy fruity nose. Mango, citrus, pineapple. Slightly bready with massively hoppy flavour. Nice juicy hoppy linger. Totally different beer!

Bottle from Cross Stobs Bottle Shop, Barrhead.  A very well hopped, strong citrus ale.  Good amount of carbonation, enjoyable and not my style of beer normally.  You can imagine enjoying a nice summers evening supping this.  Not many of those in Scotland!

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2011 500ml bottle from Mondial private imports. 

Appearance : Perfectly clear pale yellow with a nice white head. Some lacing. Nice head retention.

Aroma : Powerful (for the abv) dry hop. Great floral notes with herbal hints. Very fresh and leafy hops. Great malty background too. Can smell my glass a foot away. 

Taste : Awesome leafy and floral hops. Light fruity passion fruits notes. Finish is quite malty with lots of hops. A bit piny and resinous but mostly floral and leafy. Finish is sharp and crisp with some bitterness. 

Palate : Carbonation is quite fizzy but its not harsh nor aggressive.

Overall : Wow very good stuff. 3 months later and this is still very impressive. Awesome hops with great malt. Very flavorful for such low abv. Extremely refreshing and quite drinkable. Great fruity finish. Stunning !

Bottled sample at Mondial 2011. 

Appearance : Clear yellow with a small head.

Aroma : Crisp malt with nice herbal hops. Nice notes of hay.

Taste : Great malt with citrusy and herbal hops. Finish is very malty with hay. Nice fruits, nice bitterness.

Palate : Soft carbonation, quaffable.

Overall : Very refreshing and drinkable. As impressive as Hurricane Jack even more since this one has half a point less abv. Really clean and sharp. Very elegant and I wish I could sample this by the pint... June 15th 2011 8,3,8,4,16;3.9

Tasting at the 18th Mondial de la bière, June 8, 2011. Blonde light, small head. Sweet hoppy aroma of herbs, a bit of mild cereal. Dry hop taste with sweet herbs, but a little refreshing, bitter herbs. Quite amazing!

Bottle from the Cave, Glasgow. Pale gold with a big, billowy white head. Massive grapefruit hop aroma with a touch of green tea. Flavour had plenty more grapefruit, some soap and sweetish malts, with a dryish finish. An excellent bottled beer.

Very pale clear straw with a thin white head with good retention and nice lacing. Aroma is citrusy and slightly piny hops (very nice hop aroma) and pale malt. Flavor is very fruity with grapefruit, lemon, orange, peach and passionfruit, nice crisp pale malt and a hint of mint. Thin body with a watery mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Very nice.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2016 My Bottom Line:
Crisp and balanced, this snappy Golden Ale seduces through its spicy, herbal and citrusy hops dallying in a lean and bubbly mouthfeel not unlike a good Kellerbier.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A foam mushroom laces atop the very pale blond.
-Malts provide haystack allusions, perfect to support the judicious hoppiness.
-This was obviously very drinkable and satisfying as a session beer.
-This is as absolutely lovely served from a cask as it is from the bottle, although both mouthfeels are obviously different. Great job Fyne Ales!

Bottles on cask at Craft Beer Co., Brighton.
A happy grapefruit bomb exploding with a cluster of rounded citrus favours. Fantastic and extremely drinkable...a perfect session beer!

50cl bottle. It pours a light lemon colour with steady bubbles and excellent head. The nose is powerful but tight and delineated with pine and grapefruit pith. There is more pine on the taste and grapefruit on the finish. The palate is fairly big in structure and texture for the style and there is a very refreshing finish. Overall, a lovely beer of which I would drink several.

Cask conditioned at The Bell, Banbury. Pale Straw with white head. Whew, this goes straight into lip puckering grapefruit mode, no messing, however; there is a little sweetness that follows the initial hit so more of a cordial flavour than freshly squeezed. Thinnish on the palate, but overall pretty decent.
Cask. The Pub, Leicester. Im pretty sure this was 3.8%. Thin white head, clear gold body. Lemon, grapefruit, tangerine. Bitter. Very drinkable with a dry finish.

Cask, gravity, at St Neots Beer Festival 11. Pale gold with a white head. Intense grapefruit hoppy aroma. Almost too strong. As is the taste. Its like fizzy grapefruit juice. Sharp bitter finish. Dont like grapefruit, and dont really like this beer.

Bottle.  Straw coloured with a fluffy foam.  Aromas are grapefruit with apricot jam.  Pink grapefruit with lemon and hay.  Grassy hops with yeast.  Flavours are sweet jammy citrus with dry woody notes and bitter, pithy grapefruit.  Crisp and hoppy.  Demands another gulp.

Cask @ Guildford Arms. Clear golden colour, sparkling white head. Aroma is massive citrus, well malted. Flavour is lots of citrus, malty backbone. Juicy. Medium bodied, well balanced and extremely drinkable. Fairly bitter finish. Another cracker by Fyne.

Very Pale yellow, clear w/ lots of bubbles
really strong yellow grapefruit rind hops. very nice!
Thin body and very fizzy
lots and lots of lemon citrus hops. One of the best british "hoppy" beeers ive ever had!

Cask @ GBBF 2010. Pours a slightly hazy pale golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity grassy fresh citrus hoppy aroma. Fruity malty grassy hoppy citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy citrus finish.

Cask (Rake, London)
6+ Yellow grapefruity aroma.
3 Pale, brief head.
7 Lovely, but simple, bitter taste. Doesnt need to be clever, its a refreshing tasty bitter, and thats just what you need sometimes.
4- Soft palate, carbonation low. Slightly grainy and pleasantly hoppy grapefruity finish.
13 Nice bitter. Good to see a blond ale with some balls.

A straw yellow pour with a mostly diminishing head.  The nose is of fresh hops, very citric indeed; theres a honey-heavy maltiness here and then some dank yeast which brings a welcomed complexity.  However, in the mouth the hops turn a regrettable corner by abandoning the floral notes of the aroma and falling too completely into the yeast character.  This impacts the malts which seem a bit too sharp for the rest of it: in a word, unbalanced.  The mouth feel is slick with a low carbonation.  It finishes on the malts and brings back a hint of the hops - but not enough.

Cask at the Jolly Butchers, London on 2nd February 2011. Clear gold body with white foam head affording full lacing. Aroma contains passion fruit, cheese and hemp notes. Main taste is grassy hop, passion fruit notes and a delightful grapefruit kick. Back-of-mouth saltiness is lovely. A bitter, grassy, lengthy and satisfying finish on a zingy mouthfeel. An excellent pint.

Cask (handpump) @ GBBF 2010, Great British Beer Festival, Earls Court Exhibition Centre, London, England.Clear light medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, fresh citrus. Flavor is moderate to light light heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, fresh citrus. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft to flat. [20100805]

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2013 Cask @ The Bon Accord & Four Marys. Bottles from Beers of Europe, Great Grog & Appelllation Wines. Citrus fruit, biscuit  & resin aroma. Very pale golden yellow colour. Biscuit & grapefruit flavour. Bitter aftertaste. Great golden ale.

(Cask at Euston Tap, Euston, London, 25 Nov 2010) Golden yellow colour with creamy, white head. Fruity nose with notes of citrus, grass and fresh hops. Fruity, malty taste with citrus, grass, biscuity malt and fresh, lemony hops in the finish. Rather light body, with some sweetness. Tasty and refreshing.
Cask gravity at GBBF 2010.  Light gold, lasting white head.  Really good hoppy ale, finish lasting and lasting, glorious bitterness goes on and on.  Really tasty beer.

[3278-20100803] Cask sample. Sweet lemon hops aroma is fragrant and fresh. Slightly hazy, light orange yellow body with a quick foamy white head. Light bitter lemon hops flavour has a great citrus hops profile and just a hint of lime zest. Light-medium body is bitter. Great aroma, wow.
(@ GBBF 2010, London, England)

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2011 [cask at the 2010 Scottish Real Ale Festival] One of the newest beers from Fyne Ales, Jarl features Citra, very much the hop du jour. The Sierra Nevada-backed hop gives a fabulous tropical fruit flavour to Jarl. Its extremely sessionable, golden and with a lovely bitter grapefruity aftertaste to compliment the pineapple up front. Pour is golden and slightly hazy, no real carbonation to speak of [27072010] Re-rate following several tastings now Jarl has become a regular beer. Its just as fabulous now - the grapefruit hit makes it such an uplifting beer to drink. Almost always perfect on cask, proof that you dont need 6%+ abv to make a flavourful beer. I actually prefer this to Avalanche now, which is a beer from FA I never thought would be surpassed. Outstanding [11072011]

Cask @ Malt & Hops Edinburgh.. Nice pale gold pour with lots of citrussy hops on the nose.. Very sharp bitter citrus flavours going on.. A touch dry but lovely bitter grapefruity tastes with nice balanced malts, but hops are winning this palate in a bitter memorable experience..
Good Brew..Ive had 3..

Cask Handpump at the GBBF, Earls Court 05/08/2010
Big hop aroma. Clear golden coloured hoppy and fruity with a grapefruit flavour. A hint of dryness in a bitter malt finish.

UPDATED: DEC 2, 2010 Cask at GBBF 2010, 3rd Aug 2010. Bright gold with a lacy white head. Wonderful floral, grapefruit nose. Every time I ran a mouthful round my mouth I got more from it - tons of peach and nectarine. Awesomely fresh tasting. Great dry citrus finish. Perfect weight. Sublime stuff, UK beer of the festival for me. I think I must have caught it at just the right time.

2010-08-03. Cask at Bow Bar beer festival.   Lovely drop of beer if you love a hoppy mouth feel.   Could have supped this all day but.....

UPDATED: NOV 14, 2012 From cask. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is cornish and grassy hoppy. Aroma is mild fruity and slight hoppy. Bitter and slight citrusy. Dry and bitter into a smooth fruity finish. Ends dry and bitter. Slight citrusy.

An absolute behemoth of a Pale Ale. Hopheads will flock to this one.Golden straw coloured and slightly smaller brother of Hurricane Jack but only in alcohol. If anything even more citrus,apricot on the nose and  palate. As good a beer brewed in Scotland ever -  at 4.0%.
Wonderful stuff.

UPDATED: FEB 24, 2011 Cask at SRAF 2010 ... amber ... light bright pine citrus hop nose ... soft mellow malts ... creamy soft lemon hop ... juicy hop ... light sweet....3.7 cask at cloisters ... golden amber ... creamy white head ... light lemon nose  ... big lemon citrusy front  juicy but quite drying 3.7
